title: Turán Threshold
content: turanThreshold(n) = n²/4 is the maximum edges without a triangle. Graphs above this threshold must contain triangles (Turán's theorem).

title: Triangle Structure
content: A triangle in G consists of three distinct vertices v1, v2, v3 that are pairwise adjacent.

title: Triangle Degree Sum
content: triangleDegreeSum(G, T) = deg(v1) + deg(v2) + deg(v3) for a triangle T = {v1, v2, v3}.

title: Function h(n)
content: h(n) = max k such that every graph on n vertices with > n²/4 edges has a triangle with degree sum ≥ k.

title: Erdős-Laskar Constant
content: 2(√3 - 1) ≈ 1.464 is the conjectured asymptotic coefficient for h(n)/n.

title: Erdős-Laskar Upper Bound (1985)
content: h(n) ≤ 2(√3-1)n. There exist graphs above Turán threshold where all triangles have degree sum at most this.

title: Fan's Lower Bound (1988)
content: h(n) ≥ (21/16)n = 1.3125n. Improved the original Erdős-Laskar lower bound.

title: Main Conjecture
content: h(n) ≥ (2(√3-1) - o(1))n. If true, the upper bound is tight and h(n)/n → 2(√3-1).

title: Extremal Graphs
content: An extremal graph achieves h(n): it's above Turán threshold but all triangles have degree sum ≤ h(n).

title: Problem Summary
content: OPEN - The gap between 1.3125n and 1.464n remains. Graphs just above Turán threshold must have triangles with high degree sum, but exact value unknown.
